text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Prime Minister Hariri to meet French President Chirac on Saturday in Paris.
-The Lebanese publishers' syndicate continues contacts to secure the release of a journalist charged with having contacts with Israel.
-Security sources say Hizbollah waged a total fo 365 attacks on Israeli forces and their allies in south Lebanon.
-Israeli warplanes raided the Mlita hills in the Hizbollah-controlled Iqlim al-Toufah ridge in the last air attack in 1996.
-The Lebanese pound rose in value 2.83 percent against the dollar in 1996, closing at 1,552 at the end of December.
